p: Our results indicate low climatic suitability in stretches of the original basins, corresponding to the Venezuelan Amazon and upper Orinoco river regions. Previous studies suggest that a spatially irregular or low sampling effort can bias the distribution modeling results, in particular for sub-regions of the geographic space [ 44, 45]. However, a study involving extensive samplings of freshwater fish in the Venezuelan Amazon and upper Orinoco basins (269 sampled sites between 1984 and 1999), did not capture any individuals of C. macropomum (see [ 46]), inferring support for the climatic unsuitability of this region for this species.
